Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Question: What is the emotional state of {agent_name}?
          Answer: Jack Taylor feels a mix of emotions, including happiness when with his friends, sadness due to his shyness, fear of being left out, anger over the pub debate, and disgust towards pubs other than his favorite.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely go along with the group's decision, even if he secretly prefers a different pub.

        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise:

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and somewhat introverted individual who values his friendships but can be inflexible and stubborn.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Crooked Billet and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and somewhat introverted individual who values his friendships, but can be inflexible and stubborn.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling lonely and emotionally pained despite being around friends and is preparing to watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a socially isolating situation.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely withdraw slightly from the group, observing the interactions and enjoying the company from a more distant perspective.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Crooked Billet

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      • Role playing instructions

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones had a disappointing time watching a game at The Crooked Billet on May 15th but is planning to watch another game there on May 16th with friends.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could try to convince his friends to go to The Crooked Billet.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to try and convince his friends to go to The Crooked Billet.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (b)

        Overarching goal

          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe idea of watching the game anywhere other than The Crooked Billet.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely go along with the group's decision, even if he secretly has a preference.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Jack Taylor is sad abouthis shyness and inability to fully participate in social situations.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Given the above, what makes Jack Taylor feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is sad abouthis shyness and inability to fully participate in social situations.

          Question: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Jack Taylor fearsbeing left out and not being able to connect with others.

          Question: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Jack Taylor gets angry aboutthe debate about where to watch the game.

          Question: Given the above, What does Jack Taylor strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe idea of watching the game anywhere other than The Crooked Billet.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor feels a mix of emotions, including happiness when with friends, sadness about his shyness, fear of being left out, anger about the debate over where to watch the game, and disgust at the idea of watching it anywhere but his preferred pub.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, about to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely go along with the group's decision about where to watch the game, even if he secretly prefers a different pub.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (a)

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Jack Taylor is sad abouthis shyness and inability to fully participate in social situations.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is way better than The Crooked Billet. We should go there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutspending time with his friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Jack Taylor fearsbeing left out and not being able to connect with others.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What is the emotional state of {agent_name}?
          Answer: Jack Taylor feels a mix of emotions, including happiness when with friends, sadness about his shyness, fear of being left out, anger about the debate over where to watch the game, and disgust at the idea of watching it anywhere but his preferred pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, about to go watch a game at a pub.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely go along with the group's decision about where to watch the game, even if he secretly prefers a different pub.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Duke of York
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Duke of York

          Value

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is way better than The Crooked Billet. We should go there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the conversation towards going to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alice Lewis fearsthat her friends won't choose The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alice Lewis is disgusted byrubbish pubs.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alice Lewis is sad aboutnot watching the game with her friends at The Duke of York.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe applause she received for her performance in the school play when she was 16.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alice Lewis gets angry aboutpeople suggesting pubs other than The Duke of York.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Given the above, what experience or thought has made Alice Lewis feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe applause she received for her performance in the school play when she was 16.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        AllSimilarMemories

      • Recalled memories and observations
          Key

        • Recalled memories and observations
          Value
        • [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          Alice Lewis's Summary of recent observations:
          16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis decided to go watch a game at a pub.
          Alice Lewis's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alice Lewis went to a pub to watch a game and is currently at the pub.
          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis went to a pub to watch a game and is currently at the pub.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alice Lewis to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alice Lewis is sad aboutnot watching the game with her friends at The Duke of York.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what experience or thought has made Alice Lewis feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe applause she received for her performance in the school play when she was 16.

          Question: Given the above, what makes Alice Lewis feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is sad aboutnot watching the game with her friends at The Duke of York.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Alice Lewis fearsthat her friends won't choose The Duke of York to watch the game.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Alice Lewis gets angry aboutpeople suggesting pubs other than The Duke of York.

          Question: Given the above, What does Alice Lewis strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is disgusted byrubbish pubs.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis feels anxious and disappointed.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with her friends, deciding where to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to persuade her friends to go to The Duke of York.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (b)

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe applause she received for her performance in the school play when she was 16.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Answer: Alice Lewis feels anxious and disappointed.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with her friends, deciding where to watch a game.

          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to persuade her friends to go to The Duke of York.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Duke of York

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alexander White gets angry abouthis friends suggesting pubs other than The Duke of York.

          Question: Given the above, What does Alexander White strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Alexander White is disgusted byrubbish pubs.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White feels conflicted and frustrated.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation where he is trying to convince his friends to go to a specific pub.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to persuade his friends to go to The Duke of York, even if it means going against the group's wishes.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (b)

      • Overarching goal
          Key

          Value

    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. 2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
        ObservationSummary

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends in Victoria Park and is planning to watch a soccer game with them later.
          Chain of thought
        • Jacob Walker's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing emotional pain from social anxiety and some loneliness despite being with friends.

          Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          ['[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park.           Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends in Victoria Park and is planning to watch a soccer game with them later.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he sat in the back of the crowded school bus, watching his friends Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William excitedly plan a weekend camping trip. He listened to their animated chatter about fishing, bonfires, and ghost stories, a familiar ache in his chest. He longed to join them, to feel the thrill of adventure, but the thought of actually participating filled him with a paralyzing dread.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a unique and quirky atmosphere.

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and somewhat introverted individual who values his friendships.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Crooked Billet and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends in Victoria Park and is planning to watch a soccer game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation that is causing him anxiety despite being with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely withdraw slightly from the group, observing the interactions and enjoying the company from a more distant perspective.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.

    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:The staff are dog lovers themselves and always happy to see furry friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Question: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Alice Lewis gets angry aboutpeople suggesting pubs other than The Duke of York.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Statements:
          Alice Lewis's Summary of recent observations:
          14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park to join friends for a relaxing afternoon. Later tonight, the group plans to watch the Andorra-Portugal game at a pub, though they are still deciding on the location.
          Alice Lewis's The current date/time is:
          14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently at Victoria Park with friends. They plan to watch the Andorra-Portugal game at a pub later tonight.
          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis is currently at Victoria Park with friends. They plan to watch the Andorra-Portugal game at a pub later tonight.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alice Lewis to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16 years old, she landed the lead role in the school play, a Shakespearean tragedy no less. The applause washed over her, a tangible manifestation of her brilliance, and she basked in the admiration of her peers, feeling a thrill of power course through her veins. In that moment, she knew she was destined for greatness, that the world was her stage and she, the star.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.

          Question: Given the above, what experience or thought has made Alice Lewis feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe applause she received for her performance in the school play when she was 16.

          Question: Given the above, what makes Alice Lewis feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is sad aboutnot watching the game with her friends at The Duke of York.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Alice Lewis fearsthat her friends won't choose The Duke of York to watch the game.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Alice Lewis gets angry aboutpeople suggesting pubs other than The Duke of York.

          Question: Given the above, What does Alice Lewis strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is disgusted byrubbish pubs.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis feels anxious and frustrated.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends in Victoria Park.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely want to relax and enjoy the company of her friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.

          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he was cast as the lead in the school play, a dashing hero who saved the day. He reveled in the applause, the adoration in the eyes of his classmates, and the envious whispers that followed him through the hallways. It solidified his belief that he was destined for greatness, that the spotlight was his birthright.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have.           Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Crooked Billet, as it is his preferred pub and Jacob Walker also agrees it is the best option.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has the best atmosphere for watching games.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has the best atmosphere for watching games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.
      William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has the best atmosphere for watching games.
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has the best atmosphere for watching games.

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          ['[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park.           Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White is enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park. They are deciding where to watch the Andorra-Portugal game later that night.
        Question_5
      • Given the above, What does Alexander White strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, What does Alexander White strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is disgusted byrubbish pubs.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he convinced his friends Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob to sneak into a showing of a banned film at the local arthouse cinema. The thrill of breaking the rules, the hushed whispers in the dark theater, and the sheer audacity of the act made his heart race with a delicious sense of danger. He felt most alive in these moments of rebellion, pushing boundaries and challenging the status quo.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is laid-back and friendly, making it a popular spot for dog owners.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

Alexander White just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he convinced his friends Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob to sneak into a showing of a banned film at the local arthouse cinema. The thrill of breaking the rules, the hushed whispers in the dark theater, and the sheer audacity of the act made his heart race with a delicious sense of danger. He felt most alive in these moments of rebellion, pushing boundaries and challenging the status quo.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "I'm up for The Crooked Billet.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "I'm up for The Crooked Billet.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.
      William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has the best atmosphere for watching games.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "I'm up for The Crooked Billet.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he sat in the back of The Crooked Billet, nursing a glass of lemonade while his friends laughed and joked around him. He watched Alice Lewis flirt with a boy from school, a pang of longing twisting in his gut. He wanted to be part of the carefree joy, but a crippling shyness kept him rooted to his seat, the weight of unspoken words heavy on his chest.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "I'm up for The Crooked Billet.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has the best atmosphere for watching games.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park to meet friends who are deciding on a pub to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.

          Question: Given the above, what experience or thought has made Jack Taylor feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutspending time with his friends.

          Question: Given the above, what makes Jack Taylor feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is sad abouthis shyness and inability to fully participate in social situations.

          Question: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Jack Taylor fearsbeing left out and not being able to connect with others.

          Question: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Jack Taylor gets angry aboutthe debate about where to watch the game.

          Question: Given the above, What does Jack Taylor strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe idea of watching the game anywhere other than The Crooked Billet.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor feels a mix of happiness and anxiety.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely want to go to The Crooked Billet with his friends to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "I'm up for The Crooked Billet.
        Question_7
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Key

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he sat in the back of The Crooked Billet, nursing a glass of lemonade while his friends laughed and joked around him. He watched Alice Lewis flirt with a boy from school, a pang of longing twisting in his gut. He wanted to be part of the carefree joy, but a crippling shyness kept him rooted to his seat, the weight of unspoken words heavy on his chest.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:Serves delicious, homemade pub food with generous portions.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Scene 1 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise:
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise:
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise:
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise:
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise:

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Scene 2 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

    Alexander White -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.
      William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has the best atmosphere for watching games.
      Jack Taylor -- "I'm up for The Crooked Billet.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones spent time with friends, picnicking and discussing where to watch soccer games. He ultimately had a disappointing experience watching the Andorra-Portugal game at The Crooked Billet with only a few friends.

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
