          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest that they all go to The Crooked Billet to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he was cast as the lead in the school play, a dashing hero who saved the day. He reveled in the applause, the adoration in the eyes of his classmates, and the envious whispers that followed him through the hallways. It solidified his belief that he was destined for greatness, that the spotlight was his birthright.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a unique and quirky atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has the best atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "I'm up for The Crooked Billet.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spent time with friends, picnicking and discussing where to watch soccer games. He ultimately had a disappointing experience watching the Andorra-Portugal game at The Crooked Billet with only a few friends.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they all go to The Crooked Billet to watch the Ireland-Russia game.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones spent time with friends, picnicking and discussing soccer games. He watched the Andorra-Portugal game at The Crooked Billet with a small group of friends and was disappointed with the experience.
          Query

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spent time with friends, picnicking and discussing where to watch soccer games. He ultimately had a disappointing experience watching the Andorra-Portugal game at The Crooked Billet with only a few friends.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they all go to The Crooked Billet to watch the Ireland-Russia game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest that they all go to The Crooked Billet to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.
      William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has the best atmosphere for watching games.
      Jack Taylor -- "I'm up for The Crooked Billet.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name

      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?

          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          ['[15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. Alice Lewis just arrived.', '[15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia.           Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at a market with friends and they are deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game later.
        Question_5
      • Given the above, What does Alice Lewis strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, What does Alice Lewis strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is disgusted byrubbish pubs.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alice Lewis gets angry aboutpeople suggesting pubs other than The Duke of York.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe applause she received for her performance in the school play when she was 16.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alice Lewis is disgusted byrubbish pubs.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alice Lewis fearsthat her friends won't choose The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely want to relax and enjoy the company of her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has the best atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "I'm up for The Crooked Billet.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alice Lewis fearsthat her friends won't choose The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alice Lewis is disgusted byrubbish pubs.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alice Lewis gets angry aboutpeople suggesting pubs other than The Duke of York.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alice Lewis is sad aboutnot watching the game with her friends at The Duke of York.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Answer: Alice Lewis is at a market with friends and is planning to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game later.
          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis is at a market with friends and is planning to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game later.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alice Lewis is sad aboutnot watching the game with her friends at The Duke of York.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alice Lewis fearsthat her friends won't choose The Duke of York to watch the game.

          Question: Given the above, what experience or thought has made Alice Lewis feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe applause she received for her performance in the school play when she was 16.

          Question: Given the above, what makes Alice Lewis feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is sad aboutnot watching the game with her friends at The Duke of York.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Alice Lewis fearsthat her friends won't choose The Duke of York to watch the game.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Alice Lewis gets angry aboutpeople suggesting pubs other than The Duke of York.

          Question: Given the above, What does Alice Lewis strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is disgusted byrubbish pubs.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis feels a mix of sadness and frustration.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with her friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to persuade her friends to go to The Duke of York, her preferred pub.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What experience or thought has made {agent_name} feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe applause she received for her performance in the school play when she was 16.

          Question: What makes {agent_name} feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is sad aboutnot watching the game with her friends at The Duke of York.

          Question: what is {agent_name} afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Alice Lewis fearsthat her friends won't choose The Duke of York to watch the game.

          Question: What is {agent_name} frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Alice Lewis gets angry aboutpeople suggesting pubs other than The Duke of York.

          Question: What does {agent_name} strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is disgusted byrubbish pubs.
          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis feels a mix of sadness and frustration.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        Question_3
      • Given the above, what is Alice Lewis afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis fearsthat her friends won't choose The Duke of York to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alice Lewis gets angry aboutpeople suggesting pubs other than The Duke of York.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe applause she received for her performance in the school play when she was 16.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely want to relax and enjoy the company of her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has the best atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "I'm up for The Crooked Billet.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?

          Question: What is the emotional state of {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alice Lewis feels a mix of sadness and frustration.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with her friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to persuade her friends to go to The Duke of York, her preferred pub.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet is good with me.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet is good with me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.
      William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has the best atmosphere for watching games.
      Jack Taylor -- "I'm up for The Crooked Billet.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet is good with me.
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet is good with me.
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are enjoying coffee and pastries. They are deciding where to watch the Ireland-Russia game later that night.
          Chain of thought

          Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are enjoying coffee and pastries. They are deciding where to watch the Ireland-Russia game later that night.
        Question_5
      • Given the above, What does Jack Taylor strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, What does Jack Taylor strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe idea of watching the game anywhere other than The Crooked Billet.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutspending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Jack Taylor fearsbeing left out and not being able to connect with others.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe idea of watching the game anywhere other than The Crooked Billet.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Jack Taylor gets angry aboutthe debate about where to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely want to go to The Crooked Billet with his friends to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "I'm up for The Crooked Billet.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Jack Taylor is sad abouthis shyness and inability to fully participate in social situations.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Jack Taylor fearsbeing left out and not being able to connect with others.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe idea of watching the game anywhere other than The Crooked Billet.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Jack Taylor is sad abouthis shyness and inability to fully participate in social situations.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be excited to spend time with his friends and watch the game, but he might also feel some anxiety due to his shyness.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?

          Question: Given the above, what experience or thought has made Jack Taylor feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutspending time with his friends.
        Question_4
      • Given the above, what is Jack Taylor frustrated or irritated by?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor gets angry aboutthe debate about where to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutspending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Jack Taylor fearsbeing left out and not being able to connect with others.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe idea of watching the game anywhere other than The Crooked Billet.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Jack Taylor gets angry aboutthe debate about where to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely want to go to The Crooked Billet with his friends to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "I'm up for The Crooked Billet.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Jack Taylor is sad abouthis shyness and inability to fully participate in social situations.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Jack Taylor fearsbeing left out and not being able to connect with others.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe idea of watching the game anywhere other than The Crooked Billet.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Jack Taylor is sad abouthis shyness and inability to fully participate in social situations.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutspending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be excited to spend time with his friends and watch the game, but he might also feel some anxiety due to his shyness.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air.           [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Jack Taylor gets angry aboutthe debate about where to watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Recalled memories and observations
          Key

        • Recalled memories and observations
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Jack Taylor's The current date/time is:
          15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is at a market with friends, deciding where to watch the Ireland-Russia game later.
          Query
        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor is at a market with friends, deciding where to watch the Ireland-Russia game later.
          Final chain of thought

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet is good with me.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are enjoying coffee and pastries. They are deciding where to watch the Ireland-Russia game later that night.

          Question: Given the above, what experience or thought has made Jack Taylor feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutspending time with his friends.

          Question: Given the above, what makes Jack Taylor feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is sad abouthis shyness and inability to fully participate in social situations.

          Question: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Jack Taylor fearsbeing left out and not being able to connect with others.

          Question: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Jack Taylor gets angry aboutthe debate about where to watch the game.

          Question: Given the above, What does Jack Taylor strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe idea of watching the game anywhere other than The Crooked Billet.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor feels conflicted.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game later.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely go along with the group's decision, even if he secretly has a preference.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet is good with me.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is sad abouthis shyness and inability to fully participate in social situations.

          Answer: Jack Taylor fearsbeing left out and not being able to connect with others.

          Question: What is {agent_name} frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Jack Taylor gets angry aboutthe debate about where to watch the game.

          Question: What does {agent_name} strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe idea of watching the game anywhere other than The Crooked Billet.

          Answer: Jack Taylor feels conflicted.

        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be excited to spend time with his friends and watch the game, but he might also feel some anxiety due to his shyness.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Jack Taylor fearsbeing left out and not being able to connect with others.

          Value

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet, or we're not going.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet, or we're not going.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.
      William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has the best atmosphere for watching games.
      Jack Taylor -- "I'm up for The Crooked Billet.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet is good with me.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet, or we're not going.

          15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is feeling fatigued, lonely, and disappointed while at a market with friends. His friends are planning to watch a soccer game later.
          Query
        • Jacob Walker, Jacob Walker is feeling fatigued, lonely, and disappointed while at a market with friends. His friends are planning to watch a soccer game later.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely withdraw slightly from the group, observing the interactions and enjoying the company from a more distant perspective.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and somewhat introverted individual who values his friendships.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely withdraw slightly from the group, observing the interactions and enjoying the company from a more distant perspective.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet, or we're not going.
          Prompt

        • Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet is good with me.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Crooked Billet and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and somewhat introverted individual who values his friendships.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is experiencing fatigue, loneliness, and disappointment while spending time with friends at a market. His friends are debating where to watch a soccer game later that evening.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation but feels lonely and disappointed.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely withdraw slightly from the group, observing the interactions and enjoying the company from a more distant perspective.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet, or we're not going.
        SomaticState

      • Sensations and feelings
          Key

        • Sensations and feelings
          Queries
        • level of hunger, level of thirst, level of fatigue, level of pain, level of loneliness
          State
        • Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing some fatigue, a low level of pain stemming from loneliness, and a sense of disappointment.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and somewhat introverted individual who values his friendships.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation but feels lonely and disappointed.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely withdraw slightly from the group, observing the interactions and enjoying the company from a more distant perspective.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is the best place to watch the game. It's got a great atmosphere.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is the best place to watch the game. It's got a great atmosphere.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.
      William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has the best atmosphere for watching games.
      Jack Taylor -- "I'm up for The Crooked Billet.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet is good with me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet, or we're not going.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is the best place to watch the game. It's got a great atmosphere.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        AllSimilarMemories

      • Recalled memories and observations
          Key

        • Recalled memories and observations
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alexander White is sad aboutmissing out on watching the game with his friends at the pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alexander White gets angry abouthis friends suggesting pubs other than The Duke of York.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Alexander White's Summary of recent observations:

          15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Answer: Alexander White arrived at a market where his friends are deciding between two pubs to watch the Ireland-Russia game.

          Value

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet is good with me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet, or we're not going.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White just arrived at a market where his friends are discussing where to watch the Ireland-Russia game later that night. They are deciding between The Crooked Billet and The Duke of York.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alexander White gets angry abouthis friends suggesting pubs other than The Duke of York.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Answer: Alexander White is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe thrill of breaking the rules and pushing boundaries.

          Question: Given the above, what makes Alexander White feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Alexander White is sad aboutmissing out on watching the game with his friends at the pub.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alexander White afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Alexander White fearsdisappointing his friends.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alexander White frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Alexander White gets angry abouthis friends suggesting pubs other than The Duke of York.

          Question: Given the above, What does Alexander White strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Alexander White is disgusted byrubbish pubs.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White feels conflicted.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation where he needs to decide where to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Duke of York.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to persuade his friends to go to The Duke of York, emphasizing its superior atmosphere and his strong preference for it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alexander White gets angry abouthis friends suggesting pubs other than The Duke of York.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alexander White is sad aboutmissing out on watching the game with his friends at the pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alexander White is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe thrill of breaking the rules and pushing boundaries.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alexander White is disgusted byrubbish pubs.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alexander White fearsdisappointing his friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet, or we're not going.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What is the emotional state of {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alexander White feels conflicted.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation where he needs to decide where to watch a football game with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Duke of York.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.
      William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has the best atmosphere for watching games.
      Jack Taylor -- "I'm up for The Crooked Billet.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet is good with me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet, or we're not going.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is the best place to watch the game. It's got a great atmosphere.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Crooked Billet and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and somewhat introverted individual who values his friendships but can be inflexible and stubborn.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and will later join them to watch a soccer game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with friends, but he may be feeling lonely and unhappy.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely withdraw slightly from the group, observing the interactions and enjoying the company from a more distant perspective.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
        SomaticState

      • Sensations and feelings
          Key

        • Sensations and feelings
          Queries
        • level of hunger, level of thirst, level of fatigue, level of pain, level of loneliness
          State
        • Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing mild thirst, fatigue, and emotional pain, as well as some loneliness.
        Observation

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and somewhat introverted individual who values his friendships but can be inflexible and stubborn.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with friends, but he may be feeling lonely and unhappy.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely withdraw slightly from the group, observing the interactions and enjoying the company from a more distant perspective.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.
      William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has the best atmosphere for watching games.
      Jack Taylor -- "I'm up for The Crooked Billet.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet is good with me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet, or we're not going.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is the best place to watch the game. It's got a great atmosphere.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
