        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park to join friends for a sunny afternoon of relaxation. Later that evening, the group plans to watch the Serbia-Andorra game and is debating where to go.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alice Lewis is sad aboutnot watching the game with her friends at The Duke of York.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Given the above, what experience or thought has made Alice Lewis feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe applause she received for her performance in the school play when she was 16.

          Question: Given the above, what makes Alice Lewis feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is sad aboutnot watching the game with her friends at The Duke of York.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Alice Lewis fearsthat her friends won't choose The Duke of York to watch the game.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Alice Lewis gets angry aboutpeople suggesting pubs other than The Duke of York.

          Question: Given the above, What does Alice Lewis strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is disgusted byrubbish pubs.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis feels a mix of sadness, anger, and disgust.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a relaxed and social situation with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the conversation towards going to The Duke of York to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...

          Question: What is the emotional state of {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alice Lewis feels a mix of sadness, anger, and disgust.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a relaxed and social situation with her friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the conversation towards going to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?"
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.
      William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has the best atmosphere for watching games.
      Jack Taylor -- "I'm up for The Crooked Billet.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet is good with me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet, or we're not going.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is the best place to watch the game. It's got a great atmosphere.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?"

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, whether it's at a market, a park, or watching a football game at a pub, but he can be disappointed when things don't go according to plan.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?"
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they all go to The Crooked Billet to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest that they all go to The Crooked Billet.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?"

        Overarching goal

          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

      • Observation

          Value
        • [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is way better than The Crooked Billet. We should go there.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is way better than The Crooked Billet. We should go there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.
      William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has the best atmosphere for watching games.
      Jack Taylor -- "I'm up for The Crooked Billet.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet is good with me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet, or we're not going.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is the best place to watch the game. It's got a great atmosphere.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?"


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is way better than The Crooked Billet. We should go there.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alexander White is sad aboutmissing out on watching the game with his friends at the pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alexander White is sad aboutmissing out on watching the game with his friends at the pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alexander White is sad aboutmissing out on watching the game with his friends at the pub.

          Question: Given the above, what experience or thought has made Alexander White feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Alexander White is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe thrill of breaking the rules and pushing boundaries.

          Question: Given the above, what makes Alexander White feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Alexander White is sad aboutmissing out on watching the game with his friends at the pub.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alexander White afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Alexander White fearsdisappointing his friends.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alexander White frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Alexander White gets angry abouthis friends suggesting pubs other than The Duke of York.

          Question: Given the above, What does Alexander White strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Alexander White is disgusted byrubbish pubs.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White feels conflicted.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends at a park.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Duke of York for the game later.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is way better than The Crooked Billet. We should go there.

          Question: What is the emotional state of {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alexander White feels conflicted.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends at a park.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Duke of York for the game later.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?"

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet is a good choice. I'm up for that.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet is a good choice. I'm up for that.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.
      William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has the best atmosphere for watching games.
      Jack Taylor -- "I'm up for The Crooked Billet.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet is good with me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet, or we're not going.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is the best place to watch the game. It's got a great atmosphere.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is way better than The Crooked Billet. We should go there.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet is a good choice. I'm up for that.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutspending time with his friends.

          Question: Given the above, what makes Jack Taylor feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is sad abouthis shyness and inability to fully participate in social situations.

          Question: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Jack Taylor fearsbeing left out and not being able to connect with others.

          Question: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Jack Taylor gets angry aboutthe debate about where to watch the game.

          Question: Given the above, What does Jack Taylor strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe idea of watching the game anywhere other than The Crooked Billet.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor feels a mix of emotions, including happiness when with his friends, sadness due to his shyness, fear of being left out, anger over the pub debate, and disgust towards pubs other than his favorite.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely go along with the group's decision, even if he secretly prefers a different pub.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet is a good choice. I'm up for that.
        Question_7
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Key

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely go along with the group's decision, even if he secretly has a preference.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Jack Taylor gets angry aboutthe debate about where to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Jack Taylor is sad abouthis shyness and inability to fully participate in social situations.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutspending time with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Jack Taylor fearsbeing left out and not being able to connect with others.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe idea of watching the game anywhere other than The Crooked Billet.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Jack Taylor gets angry aboutthe debate about where to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely go along with the group's decision, even if he secretly has a preference.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Jack Taylor is sad abouthis shyness and inability to fully participate in social situations.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutspending time with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Jack Taylor fearsbeing left out and not being able to connect with others.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe idea of watching the game anywhere other than The Crooked Billet.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.

          Question: What is the emotional state of {agent_name}?
          Answer: Jack Taylor feels a mix of emotions, including happiness when with his friends, sadness due to his shyness, fear of being left out, anger over the pub debate, and disgust towards pubs other than his favorite.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely go along with the group's decision, even if he secretly prefers a different pub.

          Value

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise:
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise:
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise:
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise:
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise:

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Duke of York
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Duke of York
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.
          Chain of thought

          ['[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] ']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.
        Question_5
      • Given the above, What does Alexander White strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, What does Alexander White strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is disgusted byrubbish pubs.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is laid-back and friendly, making it a popular spot for dog owners.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alexander White is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe thrill of breaking the rules and pushing boundaries.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alexander White is sad aboutmissing out on watching the game with his friends at the pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alexander White is disgusted byrubbish pubs.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alexander White gets angry abouthis friends suggesting pubs other than The Duke of York.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alexander White fearsdisappointing his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest watching the game at The Duke of York.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has the best atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "I'm up for The Crooked Billet.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Given the above, what experience or thought has made Alexander White feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Alexander White is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe thrill of breaking the rules and pushing boundaries.

          Question: Given the above, what makes Alexander White feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Alexander White is sad aboutmissing out on watching the game with his friends at the pub.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alexander White afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Alexander White fearsdisappointing his friends.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alexander White frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Alexander White gets angry abouthis friends suggesting pubs other than The Duke of York.

          Question: Given the above, What does Alexander White strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Alexander White is disgusted byrubbish pubs.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White feels a complex mix of emotions. He is excited about the prospect of watching the game, but also feels anxious about potentially disappointing his friends and frustrated by their suggestions of pubs he deems inferior. His strong preference for The Duke of York and disgust for other pubs indicate a stubborn streak and a desire for things to be done his way. His sadness about potentially missing out on watching the game with his friends suggests a strong desire for social connection and belonging.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a dilemma about where to watch the game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to persuade his friends to go to The Duke of York, emphasizing its superior atmosphere and his strong preference for it.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (b)

          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White feels a complex mix of emotions. He is excited about the prospect of watching the game, but also feels anxious about potentially disappointing his friends and frustrated by their suggestions of pubs he deems inferior. His strong preference for The Duke of York and disgust for other pubs indicate a stubborn streak and a desire for things to be done his way. His sadness about potentially missing out on watching the game with his friends suggests a strong desire for social connection and belonging.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "I'm up for The Crooked Billet.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.

          Question: What is the emotional state of {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alexander White feels a complex mix of emotions. He is excited about the prospect of watching the game, but also feels anxious about potentially disappointing his friends and frustrated by their suggestions of pubs he deems inferior. His strong preference for The Duke of York and disgust for other pubs indicate a stubborn streak and a desire for things to be done his way. His sadness about potentially missing out on watching the game with his friends suggests a strong desire for social connection and belonging.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a dilemma about where to watch the game.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to persuade his friends to go to The Duke of York, emphasizing its superior atmosphere and his strong preference for it.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a reserved and somewhat introverted individual who values his friendships.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he sat in the back of the crowded school bus, watching his friends Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William excitedly plan a weekend camping trip. He listened to their animated chatter about fishing, bonfires, and ghost stories, a familiar ache in his chest. He longed to join them, to feel the thrill of adventure, but the thought of actually participating filled him with a paralyzing dread.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt

        • Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Crooked Billet and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and somewhat introverted individual who values his friendships.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling a mix of excitement and anxiety and is getting ready to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, about to go watch a football game with his friends at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely withdraw slightly from the group, observing the interactions and enjoying the company from a more distant perspective.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Crooked Billet

          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he sat in the back of the crowded school bus, watching his friends Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William excitedly plan a weekend camping trip. He listened to their animated chatter about fishing, bonfires, and ghost stories, a familiar ache in his chest. He longed to join them, to feel the thrill of adventure, but the thought of actually participating filled him with a paralyzing dread.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

It solidified his belief that he was destined for greatness, that the spotlight was his birthright.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: William Jones could leave for The Crooked Billet pub to meet his friends and watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to leave for The Crooked Billet pub.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Duke of York

          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          ['[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] ']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis decided to go watch a game at a pub.
        Question_5
      • Given the above, What does Alice Lewis strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, What does Alice Lewis strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is disgusted byrubbish pubs.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:The staff are dog lovers themselves and always happy to see furry friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe applause she received for her performance in the school play when she was 16.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alice Lewis is sad aboutnot watching the game with her friends at The Duke of York.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alice Lewis fearsthat her friends won't choose The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alice Lewis gets angry aboutpeople suggesting pubs other than The Duke of York.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely want to relax and enjoy the company of her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has the best atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "I'm up for The Crooked Billet.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alice Lewis is disgusted byrubbish pubs.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is disgusted byrubbish pubs.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Value

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is sad aboutnot watching the game with her friends at The Duke of York.

          Answer: Alice Lewis fearsthat her friends won't choose The Duke of York to watch the game.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Alice Lewis gets angry aboutpeople suggesting pubs other than The Duke of York.

          Question: Given the above, What does Alice Lewis strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is disgusted byrubbish pubs.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis feels a mix of sadness, anxiety, and anger.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a dilemma about where to watch the game with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to persuade her friends to go to The Duke of York.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (b)

          Question: What makes {agent_name} feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is sad aboutnot watching the game with her friends at The Duke of York.

          Question: what is {agent_name} afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Alice Lewis fearsthat her friends won't choose The Duke of York to watch the game.

          Question: What is {agent_name} frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Alice Lewis gets angry aboutpeople suggesting pubs other than The Duke of York.

          Question: What does {agent_name} strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is disgusted byrubbish pubs.
          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis feels a mix of sadness, anxiety, and anger.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        Question_3
      • Given the above, what is Alice Lewis afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis fearsthat her friends won't choose The Duke of York to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:The staff are dog lovers themselves and always happy to see furry friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe applause she received for her performance in the school play when she was 16.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alice Lewis is sad aboutnot watching the game with her friends at The Duke of York.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alice Lewis fearsthat her friends won't choose The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alice Lewis gets angry aboutpeople suggesting pubs other than The Duke of York.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely want to relax and enjoy the company of her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York would be a great place to watch the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has the best atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "I'm up for The Crooked Billet.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alice Lewis is disgusted byrubbish pubs.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.

          Question: What is the emotional state of {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alice Lewis feels a mix of sadness, anxiety, and anger.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a dilemma about where to watch the game with her friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to persuade her friends to go to The Duke of York.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet
      Context for action selection and components

          Value

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.
          Chain of thought

          ['[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] ']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.
        Question_5
      • Given the above, What does Jack Taylor strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?

        • Question: Given the above, What does Jack Taylor strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe idea of watching the game anywhere other than The Crooked Billet.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has the best atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutspending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Jack Taylor is sad abouthis shyness and inability to fully participate in social situations.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Jack Taylor fearsbeing left out and not being able to connect with others.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe idea of watching the game anywhere other than The Crooked Billet.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Jack Taylor gets angry aboutthe debate about where to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely want to go to The Crooked Billet with his friends to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "I'm up for The Crooked Billet.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. All the others are rubbish.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet is a great shout, Jacob's right, it's the best place to watch.

          Question: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor frustrated or irritated by?
